comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Thanks to San Diego Air and Space Museum Archive for picture. EKA-3B Skywarrior Bu No 142650 Modex 50 Tail code TR of VAQ-135 'Black Ravens'. Very large squadron emblem on tail. Flying over San Francisco Bay with Golden Gate Bridge behind Note teardrop shapes of removed ECM aerials on both fore and aft of fuselage. VAQ-135 established May 15, 1969 to provide electronic warfare and aerial refueling support to carrier air wings. Originally based Naval Air Station Alameda, California. Flew Douglas EKA-3B Skywarrior and deployed on several occasions to both Atlantic and Pacific Fleets. From 1973 VAQ-135 relocated NAS Whidbey Island, Washington and transitioned to Grumman EA-6B Prowler. Same picture (but cropped) of EKA-3B 142650 as in 'flickr' pic: aerofiles.com/doug-a3b.jpg Three pictures of EKA-3B 142650 as in 'flickr' pic: vietnam.warbirdsresourcegroup.org/a3skywarrior-gallery.ht... (one as in 'flickr' pic plus excellent large one of it winging over away from camera ship) app.razorplanet.com/acct/42440-9650/tmpl/index.php?nid=10... Inbound to NAS Alameda passing over the Golden Gate Bridge, an EKA3-B (142650) of VAQ-135 is looking good. Photo was taken from KA-3B (138914) on return trip from Mt. Shasta photo hop on April 10, 1973. Photo by Harry S. Gann Douglas A3D-2/A-3B Skywarrior: www.joebaugher.com/usattack/newa3_3.html Details of A3D-2/A-3B production with conversions. (Many thanks to Professor Joe Baugher, Chicago, Illinois, USA) A-3 Skywarrior lists with EKA-3B 142650 included, and notes: (Use slider bar on right to scroll down to entry) www.vaq34.com/a3list/142236-142673.htm www.a3skywarrior.com/html_files/a-3production.html Constructor consecutive number:178. Built as an A3D-2 and first to tanker configuration. Constructor Number; 11713. Date accepted by US Navy; Dec 1958. Date Struck Off Charge; Aug 1990. (above info thanks to "The Skywarrior Association") A-3B 142650 was built to be an aerial refueler and later converted to EKA-3B. Early in its life A-3B 142650 was used for testing: www.chinalakealumni.org/IMAGES/1961/142650%20A3D-2%2001SE... 'VAH-9 A3D-2 Skywarrior BuNo 142650, Project Cyclops, China Lake, 01 September 1961.' EKA-3B 142650 is recorded as having served aboard CVA-19 USS HANCOCK: www.gonavy.jp/CVW21-NP1970.html This was with VAQ-129DET.19 wearing Modex code 615 as part of Carrier Air Wing Twenty One, CVW-21 (tail code NP) between Oct.22, 1970 & June 2, 1971. On a Vietnam War deployment. Info on EKA-3B 142650: www.joebaugher.com/navy_serials/thirdseries17.html 142630/142665.Douglas A3D-2 Skywarrior c/n 11693/11728. Redesignated A-3B in 1962. 142650 (c/n 11713) to AMARC as 2A0124 Aug 13, 1990. SOC at AMARC Aug 1990. Scrapped at AMARC (Thanks to Professor Joe Baugher, Chicago, Illinois, USA) "The AMARC Experience" website page with info on EKA-3B 142650: www.amarcexperience.com/AMARCDB.asp?Type=3&Include=3&... www.amarcexperience.com/AMARCSubmittedInformationDB.asp?T... 'Information on Douglas KA-3B Skywarrior 142650' "BuNo 142650 was my dad's plane. He flew with VAQ-132 as a bombardier-navigator. The plane's callsign was "Swamp Fox 6-1-5." My dad's handle was "Doc." I have a number of pictures of this aircraft that clearly show my dad in his "office," and would glady send a couple of scanned JPEGS your way if you think they may add to your history in any positive way. My dream has been to find my dad's old aircraft, and to actually take a picture of it in its present condition, if such a thing is possible. Dad died of cancer back in 2001, and finding his plane one last time would be a kind of catharsis for me. But according to your site, after arriving at AMARC in 1990, the aircraft disposition is unknown. William L. Henderson II " swampfox612@comcast.net 'The AMARC Experience' Visitor Guestbook web page with entry concerning EKA-3B 142650: www.amarcexperience.com/AMARCGuestBookPublic.asp "As a VAQ-135 Det5 plane captain, BuNo 142650 (EKA-3B) was my personal bird in 1972. I was hoping to know if you have her in a photo at AMARC, and if AMARC is open to the public for visitation rights. Thanks! Marty Welch Vacaville, Ca - 18:58:40 13 July 2001" Picture of KA-3B 142650 with VAQ-33: app.razorplanet.com/acct/42440-9650/tmpl/index.php?nid=10... KA-3B Bu No 142650. VAQ-33 tail code GD. Modex 100. AMARC info from 2000 & 2001 records that EKA-3B 142650 was in markings of VAQ-33 and wore Modex 100 with tail code GD home.clara.net/mwindridge/Database/18Feb00/area_24.htm home.clara.net/mwindridge/Database/20May01/area_241.htm Type….Number..Store Code..Code….Sqd…….Loc…….Arrival Date KA-3B..142650…AN2A0124..GD100..VAQ-33..241405..13/08/1990 It was stored in Area 24, Row 14, Position 05 A-3 Skywarrior’s in AMARC Arizona Desert Storage with info and pictures: (Use slider bar on right to scroll down to entry) www.a3skywarrior.com/PDFs/A-3_Storage_List_2008.pdf "Skywarriors scrapped by HVF West, Fritz Enterprises, or Consolidated Aero Corp:" Entry for 2003 includes 142650. So at sometime during 2003 EKA-3B 142650 was scrapped.

comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: EKA-3B Skywarrior Bu No 142650 may also be viewed in this overexposed 'bled' 'flickr' pic offering by SDASM Archives here: www.flickr.com/photos/sdasmarchives/4556339072/ VAQ-129 Modex 615. Tail code NP of CVW-21 USS Hancock Possible time period may be deduced from here: www.gonavy.jp/CVW-NPf.html Some time before or between Oct.22, 1970 & June 2, 1971 (Vietnam War deployment) And here to confirm that VAQ-129 was equipped with KA-3B, one of which was 142650 Modex 615. www.gonavy.jp/CVW21-NP1970.html

comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Go here for info on VAQ-135: vaq135.ahf.nmci.navy.mil/ "The BLACK RAVENS of Tactical Electronic Warfare Squadron ONE THREE FIVE were established on 15 May 1969 to provide electronic warfare and aerial refueling support to carrier air wings. Homeported at NAS Alameda, California, the BLACK RAVENS first flew the Douglas EKA-3B “Skywarrior” and deployed to both the Atlantic and Pacific Fleets." And here (scroll down page): app.razorplanet.com/acct/42440-9650/tmpl/index.php?nid=10... "On May 15,1969, one of VAQ-130 detachments was enlarged into a new TACELRON, VAQ-135, homeported at NAS Alameda, California. The new unit first deployed to Southeast Asia aboard the USS Coral Sea (CVA-43) in September, 1969. In July, 1970, as other TACELRONs were transitioning to the EA-6B, VAQ-135 was reorganized into a permanently shore-based component and five sea-going detachments. From November, 1971, until January, 1974, these detachments deployed to Yankee Station twice aboard the USS Coral Sea (CVA-43) and USS Hancock (CVA-19), and once aboard the USS Kitty Hawk (CVA-63)……."
